summary: This is a letter from United States District Judge Richard M. Berman to Warden Lamine Ntiaye of the Metropolitan Correctional Center, dated August 12, 2019, regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. Judge Berman acknowledges the tragedy and raises an open question about whether ongoing investigations will include an incident involving Epstein at the MCC on or about July 23, 2019, noting that the Bureau of Prisons' conclusions about that incident have never been definitively explained.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Judge Richard M. Berman references an unexplained incident involving Epstein at the MCC on or about July 23, 2019, prior to his death.
Judge Berman states the Bureau of Prisons' conclusions about the July 23 incident have never been definitively explained.
The letter is copied to Chief Judge Colleen McMahon, District Executive Edward Friedland, and Epstein's attorney Martin Weinberg, indicating broad official awareness.
